posts.post_text: May 23, 2014 at 8:52 PM#2this should do the job:Preview Cue [color=#FF0000](load current cue in the previeweditor)[/color]Preview Cue Previous  [color=#FF0000](load last cue in the previeweditor)[/color]PreviewEdit Off [color=#FF0000](exit previeweditor)[/color]At Cue PreviewExecutor /status [color=#FF0000](fetch values from current cue of the previewExec, which is the last cue)[/color]---- but what is the purpose of this functionality?if it is to prevent the fixture to change/move in the current cue, on a tracking console, removing the fixture from the current cue, would be the usual approach:Remove Fixture xUpdateor if fixture x is already selected:Remove SelectionUpdate(Remove=2xDelete, Selection=2xFixture)

posts.author: glad
posts.post_text: May 24, 2014 at 5:30 PM#4still, I would recommend to remove the attributes, and set dimmer to zero, rather than copying them from previous cue.- it is the existance of different values in the fadeout cue that causes you problem.Copying the values from previous cue, is a short term solution, the problem would re-appear next time you change the original cue.a macro withCodeRemove SelectionAt 0should solve your transition issue AND prevent it from happen again
